txt.en: 'Do as he says, Sm√©agol. He will not hurt you. Trust me, and all will be well.'
'This is a true promise, and if you cannot accept it then you should carry out your law. But there is no greater oath he can make.'
Instance: A Troubling Path
'Thank you. But, my lord, you have not yet given your judgment concerning said master.'
'Answer! Is that not the name of the place you are approaching?'
'I place myself at your service, Captain Faramir. Thank you.'
'I wonder if there is no other way. Who could know that for certain?'
'I can answer, if he will not. He took us to the Black Gate at my bidding, but we could not hope to enter there.'
'Take him away, Anborn. Be gentle with him, but watch him very closely.'
'Instead we make for a path that is hidden, supposedly near Minas Ithil.'
'As you say. We will climb a high pass that leads through the mountains into the lands beyond...'
'Let us go! We've done nothing wrong.'
'We didn't know. We are only lost, lost and hungry. We wanted nice fishes for an empty belly.'
'We swears it...'
'Master knows. We will make our promise to the Master, and to the Precious. Never come again!'
'Hsssss!'
'No!'
'Yes, yes! What is its name to us? Master tells us he must get in, so we takes him! There is no other way.'
'Nothing? You have come to fish in the Forbidden Pool, where it is death to come.'
'Come here, and let me look at you.'
'Your mind is full of locked doors with shuttered windows behind them, but I judge that you speak the truth.'
'You did not come here to present any threat to Gondor or Ithilien. What oath can you swear never to come back to this place, or lead anyone hither?'
'Then I give you to your master, for him to declare your fate however he will.'
'I say that you are free to go wherever you will in Gondor, you and your charges. You are under my protection.'
'Now, where does this creature plan to take you?'
'That is now called Minas Morgul.'
'This pass...it is called Cirith Ungol, is it not?'
